definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly
to look distracted/to stare blankly/distracted/blank/(coll.) unexpectedly/rash/rashly

sentences.english: She rose to her feet and gazed upon him, round-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 她站起身，直愣愣地看着他，眼睛瞪得圓圓的。

sentences.english: I laid up in bed and stared at the black walls a my house.
sentences.chinese: 我躺在牀上直愣愣地盯着屋裏黑的牆壁。

sentences.english: Anger punch, steady blade with soldiers rushed out of the door born rob hard away.
sentences.chinese: 刀鋒怒氣衝頭，直愣愣衝出門外與戰士們生搶硬奪。

definition: to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to stare/to look blank/to be fixed (of eyes)
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
